definition: free from external control and constraint, a writer or artist who sells services to different employers without a long-term contract with any of them
details:
adjective
- free from external control and constraint
= example: free from external control and constraint
- of a clause, capable of standing syntactically alone as a complete sentence
= example: of a clause, capable of standing syntactically alone as a complete sentence
= synonyms: main
- not controlled by a party or interest group
- (of political bodies) not controlled by outside forces
= synonyms: autonomous, sovereign, self-governing
noun
- a writer or artist who sells services to different employers without a long-term contract with any of them
= synonyms: freelance, free-lance, freelancer, free lance, self-employed person
- a neutral or uncommitted person (especially in politics)
= synonyms: mugwump, fencesitter
